Section 4. All balances of the appropriations made in sections One, Two and Three of this Act, remaining un-expected on June thirty, nineteen hundred forty-two shall revert to the General Funds, the Coconut Oil Excise Tax Fund, and the Portworks Fund created by Act Numbered Three Thousand Five hundred and ninety-two, as amended by Commonwealth Act Numbered One hundred thirty, respectively, and thereafter they shall not be available for expenditure, except upon appropriation by the National Assembly.ℒαwρhi৷
Section 5. The sums appropriated in paragraphs (c), (d), (e), and (f) of section two, and those appropriated in paragraphs (c), (d) and (e) of section three of this Act shall be distributed by the Secretary of Public Works and Communications with the approval of the President of the Philippines, but those appropriated in the other paragraphs os section two and three hereof, except those appropriated in paragraph (b) of section two which shall be distributed as directed by the President of the Philippines and those appropriated in paragraphs (a) and (b) of section one shall be available for expenditure by the Director of Public Works. All sums appropriated in section three of this Act shall be released only after certification by the Auditor-General, to the President of the Philippines that there are sufficient funds that have accrued under Act Numbered Three thousand five hundred ninety-two, as amended by Commonwealth Act Numbered One hundred thirty, to cover the items of appropriation herein authorized.
Section 6. The President of the Philippines in authorized to suspend or otherwise stop the expenditure of any amount herein appropriated for any purpose, or any portion thereof, whenever in his opinion, the public interest so requires and thereupon the funds affected by such action shall become available for any other authorized expenditures as the President may determine.
Section 7. This Act shall take effect upon its approval.
Approved, June 15, 1939
